Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) is one of India's largest multinational corporations, operating in various industries, including automotive, aerospace, and agriculture. In this essay, we will discuss M&M's operations strategy in various aspects.

Inventory Management:
M&M has a well-established inventory management system, which helps the company in maintaining an optimal level of inventory. The company uses various inventory management techniques, such as Just-in-Time (JIT), to reduce inventory carrying costs and improve the efficiency of the supply chain. M&M also uses various IT tools to monitor inventory levels and analyze the demand patterns of different products to avoid stockouts.

Supply Chain Management:
M&M has a robust supply chain management system, which involves sourcing raw materials, manufacturing products, and distributing them to various dealers and distributors. The company has implemented various supply chain management practices, such as vendor management and supplier relationship management, to ensure a steady supply of high-quality raw materials at competitive prices. M&M also uses various IT tools, such as Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, to manage its supply chain.

Logistics:
M&M has a well-developed logistics system, which involves the transportation of finished goods to dealers and distributors across the country. The company uses various transportation modes, such as road, rail, and sea, to transport its products. M&M also uses various logistics management practices, such as route optimization and fleet management, to improve the efficiency of its logistics system.

Production Management:
M&M has a well-established production management system, which involves the production of various automotive and agricultural products. The company has implemented various production management practices, such as Total Quality Management (TQM), to ensure the quality of its products. M&M also uses various IT tools, such as Computer-Aided Design (CAD) and Computer-Aided Manufacturing (CAM), to improve the efficiency of its production processes.

Policy and Regulation related to outsourcing:
M&M has a policy of outsourcing non-core activities to external vendors to focus on its core competencies. The company follows a rigorous outsourcing process, which involves selecting vendors based on their capabilities and track record. M&M also maintains close relationships with its vendors and provides them with technical and managerial support.

Industrial Processes:
M&M has developed various industrial processes to improve the efficiency and quality of its products. The company has implemented various process improvement techniques, such as Lean manufacturing and Six Sigma, to reduce waste and improve process efficiency. M&M also uses various automation technologies, such as Robotics, to improve the speed and accuracy of its production processes.

Managing Transit Risks:
M&M has a comprehensive risk management system, which involves identifying and mitigating various transit risks, such as theft, damage, and delay. The company uses various risk management techniques, such as insurance and GPS tracking, to minimize the impact of transit risks.

WTO-related aspects:
M&M operates in a global market, and its operations are subject to various international trade regulations, such as the World Trade Organization (WTO) agreements. The company complies with all WTO-related regulations and uses various international trade practices, such as exporting and importing, to expand its business globally.

Overseas payments:
M&M operates in various countries, and its operations involve making overseas payments. The company uses various payment systems, such as wire transfers and online payment gateways, to make overseas payments. M&M also maintains close relationships with its overseas partners and ensures timely payment of invoices.

Recent operations strategy issues:
M&M has faced various operations strategy issues, such as supply chain disruptions and production delays due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The company has implemented various measures, such as digitalization of operations and implementation of remote working practices, to overcome these challenges.
